I was too tired, but John was there with me with approximately 20 other people. If any one happened to notice....we still passed out during this preview - even when lovedones were kind enough to wake us up.<|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|>

While credited as a Tom and Jerry cartoon, this is not the cat-and-mouse team but an earlier Mutt-and-Jeff rip-off featuring them going about to survive in today's turbulent economy. In the end, they channel their problems over into other aspects of their lives until they are engulfed in payback wrath by another group of stick-up victims. Alan Kaplan makes his directorial debut here.
An uncontrollable "forest" on Mars threatens the future of NASA's

Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too slow and lazy and worst of all: EA have sold us a product that we already own. This mostly sums up why I dislike this parody so much.
That aside, one can’t deny that “Happily Ever After” will bring some nostalgia with it. The music and narration sound like from an old classic cartoon

What is left of Planet Earth is populated by a few poor and starving rag-tag survivors. They must eat bugs and insects, or whatever they can find. Michael Dudikoff stars as Joe Armstrong a martial artist who fights ninjas who are stealing weapons from the U.S Army, in this entertaining yet admittedly brainless comedic action film. This film is clearly an attempt to catch the wave of martial arts popularity ; It borrows heavily from Van Damme's and Steve Seagal’s TV series and movies, with few original ideas of its own.
